comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: The Harrisburg Transportation Center (formerly Pennsylvania Station, Harrisburg) is a large railway station in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania. It is located on the eastern edge of Downtown Harrisburg between the intersections of Aberdeen and Market Streets and 4th and Chestnut Streets. The well-situated station is the primary hub for passenger rail and intercity bus services in the Harrisburg metropolitan area and South Central Pennsylvania. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harrisburg_Transportation_Center

comment.author: 15283643@N04
comment._content: Nice window awnings. The original "green" way of keeping a commercial building cool.

comment.author: 15283643@N04
comment._content: No benches for patrons. They have to sit on the steps. Outrageous!

comment.author: 28752121@N06
comment._content: Fantastic old photo. I see this building every day, but never like this. :) Hi, I'm an admin for a group called PA - Dauphin County, and we'd love to have this added to the group!
